stories.title: Community Comes Together to Build Playground for Kids
stories.summary: In just one weekend, over 200 volunteers transformed an empty lot into a vibrant playground. Local businesses donated materials while neighbors brought tools and enthusiasm, creating a safe space for children to play.

stories.title: Teen Inventor Creates Device to Clean Ocean Plastic
stories.summary: A 16-year-old from California designed an affordable device that collects microplastics from ocean water. The invention has already been adopted by three coastal cleanup organizations and could revolutionize marine conservation.

stories.title: Dog Accidentally Joins Marathon, Finishes in Top 100
stories.summary: A golden retriever named Buddy slipped away from his owner and ended up running a full 26.2 miles alongside marathon participants. He crossed the finish line with an unofficial medal and became an internet sensation overnight.

stories.title: Local Pizza Shop Feeds 500 Homeless Every Sunday
stories.summary: A family-owned pizzeria in Portland started a tradition of making free pizzas for anyone who needs a meal. What began as feeding 20 people has grown into a community movement with volunteers and donors from across the city.

stories.title: High School Robotics Team Wins National Championship
stories.summary: An all-girls robotics team from a small Texas town beat 400 other teams to win first place. They designed a robot that can sort recyclables with 99% accuracy, impressing judges with both technical skill and environmental impact.

stories.title: Neighbors Create Free Tool Library for Entire Block
stories.summary: Instead of everyone buying tools they rarely use, one neighborhood created a sharing system. Residents can borrow anything from lawn mowers to power drills, saving thousands of dollars and building community connections.

stories.title: Woman Finds Purpose After Loss Through Garden Project
stories.summary: After losing her husband, Sarah started a community garden to honor his memory. Three years later, the garden feeds 50 families and has become a healing space where people share stories and support each other through grief.
